column1: Louis Armstrong,Trumpet,1920s–1960s,Traditional Jazz,Satchmo transformed jazz from ensemble-based music to a soloist’s art. With his gravelly voice and dazzling trumpet playing, Armstrong brought jazz into the mainstream and made it a cornerstone of American culture. His sense of swing, improvisation, and charisma influenced virtually every jazz musician after him.,West End Blues; What a Wonderful World; Stardust,https://open.spotify.com/artist/1gRNBaI4yn6wCCTvRhGWh8

Charlie Parker,Alto Saxophone,1940s–1950s,Bebop,Known as “Bird,” Parker revolutionized jazz with his lightning-fast lines and complex harmonies. A bebop pioneer, his playing brought a new level of sophistication to improvisation. He inspired generations of musicians to explore the boundaries of jazz.,Ko-Ko; Ornithology; Donna Lee,https://open.spotify.com/artist/0KB8aF3TH7Xy7EORn6yFkG

Miles Davis,Trumpet,1940s–1990s,Cool Jazz, Hard Bop, Modal, Fusion,Miles Davis was a master of reinvention, shaping the course of jazz across five decades. From the cool sophistication of “Kind of Blue” to the electric experimentation of “Bitches Brew,” his trumpet voice was subtle, expressive, and groundbreaking.,So What; Bitches Brew; Freddie Freeloader,https://open.spotify.com/artist/0kbYTNQb4Pb1rPbbaF0pT4

Duke Ellington,Piano, Composer, Bandleader,1920s–1970s,Big Band, Swing,Duke Ellington was not only a brilliant pianist and bandleader, but one of America’s greatest composers. His orchestra produced hundreds of compositions that blended classical structure with jazz improvisation, creating lush soundscapes. Ellington's work elevated jazz into an art form.,Mood Indigo; Take the ‘A’ Train; Cotton Tail,https://open.spotify.com/artist/53QzNeFpz7HKEfGRtwI2Zf

John Coltrane,Tenor and Soprano Saxophone,1950s–1960s,Hard Bop, Modal, Avant-Garde,Coltrane’s deeply spiritual approach and relentless practice routine pushed jazz into new realms. His landmark recordings like “A Love Supreme” demonstrated that jazz could be a medium for personal and transcendent expression.,A Love Supreme; Giant Steps; Naima,https://open.spotify.com/artist/2hGh5VOeeqimQFxqXvfCUf

Thelonious Monk,Piano,1940s–1970s,Bebop, Avant-Garde,One of jazz’s great eccentrics, Monk’s angular melodies, dissonant harmonies, and percussive piano style made him a unique voice. Despite initial resistance, he became one of the most influential composers and stylists in jazz history.,Round Midnight; Blue Monk; Straight, No Chaser,https://open.spotify.com/artist/0kbYTNQb4Pb1rPbbaF0pT4
